title: Past Presidents of the IAAF | NEWS | World Athletics
snippet: Aside the present incumbent Lamine Diack, since the IAAF was founded in 1912 only four other Presidents have been elected by Congress.

title: The Past Presidents of the IAAF | NEWS | World Athletics
snippet: Under Burghley - although he was also officially known as the 6th Marquess of Exeter after the death of his father in 1956 - athletics also enhanced its position within the Olympic movement and strengthened its financial position from the distribution of International Olympic Committee television revenues. However, his final years as IAAF president before standing down in 1976 were turbulent, with many countries outside Europe were clamouring for a greater say in the decision making of the Federation.

title: World Athletics - Wikipedia
snippet: At that meeting, 27 representatives from 17 national federations agreed to meet at a congress in Berlin, Germany, the following year, overseen by Sigfrid Edström who was to become the fledgling organisation's first president. The 1913 congress formally completed the founding of what was then known as the International Amateur Athletic Federation (IAAF).

title: SEBASTIAN COE ELECTED IAAF PRESIDENT – The European Olympic Committees
snippet: Among the first to congratulate Sebastian Coe were the current IAAF President Lamine Diack and Sergey Bubka, who was later elected as an IAAF Vice President.
